p: The study revealed that more than a third of HIV positive educators had NCDs. The more prevalent NCDs were high blood pressure and stomach ulcers. These were also the most commonly reported NCDs in the 2004/5 South African Public Schools Survey [ 16]. This suggests the intersection of NCDs with HIV has remained unchanged in the past ten years in this population. This linkage highlights the need to integrate responses for HIV and NCDs among educators in this sector.
